text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Russia's Foreign Minister Primakov to meet Lebanon's top leaders in Beirut today.
-Prime Minister Hariri consulted with President Hrawi and Parliament Speaker Berri on the formation of the new cabinet. No concrete results yet.
-Lebanese guerrillas attacked Israeli and South Lebanon Army targets in the central and eastern parts of the occupation zone.
-Environment Minister Pharaon says Lebanon will ask Germany to take back the illegal toxic waste shipment.
-Hizbollah officials told German mediator top security official Schmidbauer they had no information on Israeli pilot Arad.
-A civilian man was wounded in south Lebanon when a bomb leftover from a 17-day Israeli blitz on Lebanon in April exploded accidentally.
-The weekly treasury bill issue raised 604 billion Lebanese pounds and posted a nominal deficit of subscription against maturity of 51 billion pounds.
-Prosecutor General Addoum to discuss the issue of plastic waste with the German commercial attache today. Environment watchdog Greenpeace is ready to cooperate on the issue.
-Who will name the Christian ministers, Hariri or Hrawi?
